summary.para: Called when the Media Session selects a presentation clock.

param.name: pClock
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the presentation clock. If this parameter is NULL, the quality manager should release any references to the presentation clock.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Called when the media processor is about to deliver an input sample to a pipeline component.

param.name: pNode
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the topology node that represents the pipeline component.

param.name: lInputIndex
param.para: Index of the input stream on the topology node.

param.name: pSample
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the input sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This method is called for every sample passing through every pipeline component. Therefore, the method must return quickly to avoid introducing too much latency into the pipeline.

summary.para: Called after the media processor gets an output sample from a pipeline component.

param.name: pNode
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the topology node that represents the pipeline component.

param.name: lOutputIndex
param.para: Index of the output stream on the topology node.

param.name: pSample
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the output sample.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: This method is called for every sample passing through every pipeline component. Therefore, the method must return quickly to avoid introducing too much latency into the pipeline.

summary.para: Called when a pipeline component sends an MEQualityNotify event.

param.name: pObject
param.para: Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the object that sent the event. The object is either a Media Foundation transform (MFT) or a stream sink.

param.name: pEvent
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the event.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Called when the Media Session is about to start playing a new topology.

param.name: pTopology
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the new topology. If this parameter is NULL, the quality manager should release any references to the previous topology.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: In a typical quality manager this method does the following:

description.para: Enumerates the nodes in the topology.
Calls to get the node's underlying object.

remarks.para: The quality manager can then use the pointers to adjust audio-video quality as needed.

summary.para: Called when the Media Session is shutting down.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: The quality manager should release all references to the Media Session when this method is called.

summary.para: Adjusts playback quality. This interface is exposed by the quality manager.

remarks.para: Media Foundation provides a default quality manager that is tuned for playback. Applications can provide a custom quality manager to the Media Session by setting the MF_SESSION_QUALITY_MANAGER attribute when creating the Media Session.
